flawed_nl_solution:
One-third of all the kids are girls, which means 1/3 * 45 = <<1/3*45=135/1>>135/1 children.
So there are 45 - 135/1 = <<45-135/1=-90>>-90 boys in the classroom.
#### -90

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15, not 135/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
